title: 820-2936 enters S0 state, but has low voltages on VCore rails
message: This board is in an S0 state, but PPVCORE_S0_CPU is at .77v and PPVCORE_S0_AXG is at .45v. Shorts to ground on both of them. The other VCore rails are at their proper voltages. No obvious signs of liquid damage anywhere on the board. Because there are two separate VCore rails shorted to ground, my gut tells me the CPU is fried. But I'm a bit of a newbie, so I could easily be missing something obvious.

title: 820-2936 enters S0 state, but has low voltages on VCore rails
message:
Display is connected???
Any activity on USB??

title: 820-2936 enters S0 state, but has low voltages on VCore rails
message: Those voltages are fine and would normally indicate a board that has booted.

title: 820-2936 enters S0 state, but has low voltages on VCore rails
message: But the board will POST and turn off before it loads the OS.

title: 820-2936 enters S0 state, but has low voltages on VCore rails
message: Try  another memory module, one slot at a time, it should be PC3-10600.......

title: 820-2936 enters S0 state, but has low voltages on VCore rails
820-2936 enters S0 state, but has low voltages on VCore rails
message: Nah it won't be the RAM probably. Are you booting from a known good OSX?

title: 820-2936 enters S0 state, but has low voltages on VCore rails
message: Yep. If those rails are fine at those voltages, and even with a short to ground, then I’m at a total loss.

title: 820-2936 enters S0 state, but has low voltages on VCore rails
message: You can try the BIOS but that is last ditch effort. Make sure to keep a backup! Also check for a beep without RAM, speaker in the case must be connected.
